Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Name: Jug
Description: Globular receptacle, with a wide mouth, a rim which is moulded towards the exterior, curved walls and an unstable base. It has two small handles which start at the rim and end at the top of the body. Orangey-coloured paste. Exterior surface covered with a coating of a reddish colour, which is now almost totally lost.
